item.description:
So, this whole standup paddling event has been a bit of a pain. The free lessons have been discontinued, and they are now charging $25.00 for the lesson and all of the equipment needed.  They require a $10.00 non-refundable deposit to hold your space. This is for an hour long lesson. The problem is that the class is now limited to 8 people because there is a charge for it and we each will get our own board to use.  Before the limit was higher because we were going to be sharing boards, and it was free.  I’ve posted this event with two groups, and people are still interested in going in, but I don’t know if there will be enough slots.  From the emails I’ve received, and the postings, it seems like when all is said and done, that there will be enough space for the people who want to go. But I’m not positive. I don’t want to be responsible for anyone else’s money, nor at this point do I want to go through the list of people to check in with everyone, and possibly form another wait list. 

Rather than canceling the event, I’m giving all of you the information to call the instructor and give him your deposit and specifics for your wetsuit and booties.  Once you’ve done that, please RSVP again and indicate that you’ve paid your deposit and have a slot.  The instructor will be responsible for determining if there is any space available. If someone doesn’t get to go because there isn’t enough space, I apologize, but I’m trying to make the best of a situation that was changed on me.  The instructor will do another lesson right after the 2:00 lesson time, but I can’t stay for that.  If there is a group of people who don’t make it in for the 2:00 lesson, they will do a lesson at 3:30. You can email amongst yourselves in the group to see if anyone else wants to go, or even see if you can recruit any of your friends. I’ve looked around, and the $25.00 fee is still very reasonable; other places are getting $40.00 and up even for an hour long class. When you call to give your deposit you may want to talk to the instructor and make sure the class is what you’re looking for… I’m thinking we may get less time in the water for this lower priced class… but still a good intro.

 

The link for the surf shop is http://narragansettsurfandskate.com/?p=339.

The instructor/owner’s email is bicsurf@hotmail.com

His cell number is 401-575-0003.

 

If you are still interested in trying out SUP for free, there is a company in Westport that is having a demo day on Saturday June 18 from 2-5.  They are charging $5.00, or it is free if you bring a food donation to benefit the Westport Food Bank/Council on Aging.  They give lessons regularly as well; $55.00 for a 2 hour lesson.  Their link is http://www.ospreyseakayak.com/index.php?action=view&id=63&module=newsmodule

 

Again, I apologize for any inconvenience and/or disappointment anyone may have.  Sometimes the best laid plans don’t work.  Please email me and/or change your RSVP indicating that you have paid your deposit and are going. Specifics will be emailed the day before to people who RSVP with a paid deposit. Thanks for all of your patience.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at the Narrows River. Exact details and my cell number to follow,
item.why: Because it's new, fun, time for summer sports.

group.name: South Shore Hike, Bike & Social Club

item.name: Stand Up Paddling ..... oh yeah! Welcome water sports!
